data.meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.
data.sentence: The word اللَّهُ comes from the root ا ل ه and is associated with the meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.
The word أَلَا comes from the root ل ا and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: to will/wish. shaiun (pl. ashyaa'un) - thing/matter, affair in any way, at all, what is willed or wished, aught, any extent. In direct objective case it is often used to denote the meaning "a little", "bit", "at all". Adverbially it means "in any way", "at all".
data.sentence: The word شَيْءٍ comes from the root ش ي ا and is associated with the meanings: to will/wish. shaiun (pl. ashyaa'un) - thing/matter, affair in any way, at all, what is willed or wished, aught, any extent. In direct objective case it is often used to denote the meaning "a little", "bit", "at all". Adverbially it means "in any way", "at all".

data.meanings: To collect or gather, bring together, to contract, assemble or congregate, unite or connect or form a connection, bring into a state of union, reconcile or conciliate, put on a thing [such as clothing article], to compose/arrange/settle, to pray in congregation, determine/resolve/decide upon a thing, agree or unite in opinion, prepare or make a thing ready, dry up a thing, conspire or league with another, coexist with one, to be compact/compressed/contracted, exert one's energy, to compromise or comprehend or contain, enter or go into, to meet or be in company with another.
data.sentence: The word جَمِيعًا comes from the root ج م ع and is associated with the meanings: To collect or gather, bring together, to contract, assemble or congregate, unite or connect or form a connection, bring into a state of union, reconcile or conciliate, put on a thing [such as clothing article], to compose/arrange/settle, to pray in congregation, determine/resolve/decide upon a thing, agree or unite in opinion, prepare or make a thing ready, dry up a thing, conspire or league with another, coexist with one, to be compact/compressed/contracted, exert one's energy, to compromise or comprehend or contain, enter or go into, to meet or be in company with another.

data.meanings: day, era, time, today, this/that day, age/period of time.
data.sentence: The word يَوْمَ comes from the root ي و م and is associated with the meanings: day, era, time, today, this/that day, age/period of time.
The word يَحْلِفُونَ comes from the root ح ل ف and is associated with the meanings: To swear, make an oath.

data.meanings: Removal of that which restrains one from free actionAnything that is sentRousing, exciting, putting in motion or motionIncited, urged, instigated or awokeRaising/rousing (e.g. of the dead to life)Sleepless or wakefulHastening, quick, swift in going, impelled or propelled.
data.sentence: The word يَبْعَثُهُمُ comes from the root ب ع ث and is associated with the meanings: Removal of that which restrains one from free actionAnything that is sentRousing, exciting, putting in motion or motionIncited, urged, instigated or awokeRaising/rousing (e.g. of the dead to life)Sleepless or wakefulHastening, quick, swift in going, impelled or propelled.

data.meanings: To think, consider, suppose, imagine, be of opinion.
data.sentence: The word وَيَحْسَبُونَ comes from the root ح س ب and is associated with the meanings: To think, consider, suppose, imagine, be of opinion.

data.meanings: To lie, say what is not a fact, lie to falsely invent, tell lies about or against, fabricate a lie, relate a lie, say a falsehood, be wrong, be cut off, deceive, disappoint the expectation of.
data.sentence: The word الْكَاذِبُونَ comes from the root ك ذ ب and is associated with the meanings: To lie, say what is not a fact, lie to falsely invent, tell lies about or against, fabricate a lie, relate a lie, say a falsehood, be wrong, be cut off, deceive, disappoint the expectation of.
The word فَيَحْلِفُونَ comes from the root ح ل ف and is associated with the meanings: To swear, make an oath.
